name: Rent Arrears (Some)
short_description: Some rent arrears at notice or hearing date

arrears_at_notice.requirement: Some rent unpaid at date Section 8 notice served

arrears_at_hearing.requirement: Some rent unpaid at date of hearing (can be different arrears)
arrears_at_hearing.alternative: OR arrears at notice date, even if cleared by hearing

evidence_required: Rent account showing arrears at notice date

high_probability: Tenant made no effort to pay
Reasonable to grant possession considering all circumstances
medium_probability: Payment plan proposed but not kept
low_probability: Tenant making regular payments to reduce arrears

typical_timeline.note: Slower than Ground 8 due to discretionary nature

costs.recoverable_rent: Can claim arrears plus ongoing rent

tenant_defenses: Housing Benefit or Universal Credit delays
notes: Ground 10 is DISCRETIONARY - most flexible rent arrears ground. No minimum threshold. Often used as backup to Ground 8. Court will consider reasonableness: amount, duration, reasons, tenant efforts, vulnerability. Pre-action protocol important.
case_law: Hayman v Rowlands [1957] - Court considers all circumstances
Greenwich LBC v Regan [1996] - Small arrears rarely justify possession
Lambeth LBC v Howard [2001] - Reasonableness includes tenant's conduct
Manchester CC v Pinnock [2010] - Proportionality under Article 8 ECHR
court_considerations: What is the amount of arrears?
Has tenant tried to pay or engage?
Can arrears be managed by payment plan?
Is it reasonable in all circumstances?

steps: Give opportunity to pay or arrange payment plan
pre_action_protocol.failure: Not following protocol may mean possession refused or costs penalty

suspended_possession_order.conditions: Tenant pays current rent plus arrears installments
suspended_possession_order.benefit: Tenant can retain home if payments maintained
suspended_possession_order.note: Court often gives tenant chance to pay rather than immediate eviction
